page.title: 16POPULATION IN EAKRING
page.content: At the last census the population of the village was 401, a figure which has remained static over 30 yrs with Births, Deaths and movements of inhabitants in and out of the village keeping at the same level. Approx 25% of the village is over 65 yrs, 25% is under 18 yrs with 50% forming the remainder. One third of the inhabitants live on the Council Housing Estate which has 47 houses and there are thought to be about 22 persons living alone in the village. It is difficult to estimate but, only half of the residents were born in the village or within 10 miles, the rest form a moving population from all parts of the country dictated by employments, marriage or housing. Most familes have an average of 2 children.
